definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Doctors, however, can often use a cosmetic eye shell to make it look more natural.
sentences.chinese: 医生也会使用化妆品假眼，使它看起来更自然。

sentences.english: Some weird contacts. Or maybe she had an eye transplant.
sentences.chinese: 的确古怪，可也可能她连眼睛也是移植的假眼。

sentences.english: I take out my artificial eye, spit on it and polish it with my handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 我取下假眼，朝上面啐口唾沫，用手帕擦拭了一番。

sentences.english: British baby girl born without eyes, fake eye glasses will be installed.
sentences.chinese: 英国女婴天生没有眼睛，将安装玻璃假眼。

sentences.english: Niche of Emposca vitis (Göthe) and spiders in different tea gardens in Yingde Guangdong was systematically investigated.
sentences.chinese: 调查测定了茶园假眼小绿叶蝉与其天敌蜘蛛的生态位。

sentences.english: The spatial distribution of Empoasca vitis in organic tea garden was systematically investigated.
sentences.chinese: 系统调查了有机茶园假眼小绿叶蝉的空间分布情况。

sentences.english: One of his eyes is not true. Why didn't you tell me this before ?
sentences.chinese: 他的一只眼是假眼，你以前为什么不告诉我？

sentences.english: And then there was a glass eye .

definition: to work as spy/to act as a guide
cosmetic contact lens/big eye contact lens/circle contact lens
